citeinfo.origin: J. Runas - NPS Regional Office, Denver
citeinfo.title: Curecanti National Recreation Area Vegetation Mapping Project - Park Boundary

descript.abstract: This dataset is an ARC/INFO GIS polygon coverage of the boundary of Curecanti National Recreation Area (CURE), Colorado.
descript.purpose: To show the Curecanti National Recreation boundary. The intended use of all data in the park's GIS libaries is to support diverse park activities including planning, management, maintenance, research, and interpretation.
descript.supplinf: Three reservoirs, named for corresponding dams on the Gunnison River, form the heart of Curecanti National Recreation Area. Panoramic mesas, fjord-like reservoirs, and deep, steep and narrow canyons abound. Blue Mesa Reservoir is Colorado's largest body of water, and is the largest Kokanee Salmon fishery in the United States. Morrow Point Reservoir is the beginning of the Black Canyon of the Gunnison and below, Crystal Reservoir is the site of the Gunnison Diversion Tunnel, a National Historic Civil Engineering Landmark. Recently discovered dinosaur fossils, a 5,000 acre archeological district, a narrow gauge train, and traces of 6000 year old dwellings further enhance the offerings of Curecanti.

idinfo.useconst: Originally digitized at 1:63431- use caution when using data at scales larger than this. Park boundary has never been adequately surveyed, therefore use caution when employing coverage for land ownership determinations. This dataset should only be used for general reference purposes.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park/Curecanti National Recreation Area

citeinfo.origin: J. Runas - NPS Regional Office, Denver
citeinfo.title: Metadata for Boundary for Curecanti National Recreation Area (CURE), Colorado (2002)

citeinfo.origin: J. Runas - NPS Regional Office, Denver
citeinfo.title: Boundary for Curecanti National Recreation Area
citeinfo.othercit: This dataset is an ARC/INFO GIS polygon coverage of the boundary of Curecanti (CURE) National Recreation Area (NRA), Colorado. The dataset was last modified in August of 1991 and does not contain a parcel of land that is included in the 2002 boundary version.

attracc.attraccr: The attribute accuracy is tested by manually comparing hard copy plots of the digital data with the source materials. When attributes cannot be visually verified on plots they are interactively queried and verified on screen. In addition, the attributes are compared against a master set of valid attributes.

dataqual.logic: ARC/INFO software is used to create and maintain topological relationships between features. There are no duplicate features, but coincident lines are maintained between data layers where appropriate. Polygonal features begin and end at the same point, contain no overshoots or undershoots, and contain a single label.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is tested by visual comparison of hard copy check plots to the source materials and verifying the location of the data on screen relative to other data layers in the same geographic area.

srcinfo.srccontr: Served as the base map for spatial and attribute information.

citeinfo.title: Digital Raster Graphics (DRG's) - 1:24000 scale
citeinfo.othercit: DRG's used: Grizzly Ridge, Cimarron, Curecanti Needle, Sapinero, Little Soap Park, Carpenter Ridge, Big Mesa, McIntosh Mountain, Cathedral Peak, Cerro Summit

procstep.procdesc: Boundary digitized in GRASS software by J. Runas at NPS Regional office, Denver, at 1:63431 scale.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park/Curecanti National Recreation Area

procstep.procdesc: Two small sliver polygons removed from polygon coverage of boundary by BLCA/CURE GIS staff, in GRASS software.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park/Curecanti National Recreation Area

procstep.procdesc: Boundary file converted to ARC/INFO 7.0.4 vector polygon coverage by BLCA/CURE staff.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park/Curecanti National Recreation Area

procstep.procdesc: On-screen digitizing by D. Roberts, BLCA/CURE Management Assistant, of parcel to be added to National Recreation Area boundary. Parcel lines were based on warranty deeds (referenced for legal description) and GCDB data. Highway data, DRG's, and the older CURE boundary were also used for on-screen digitizing reference.
procstep.srcused: CURE Boundary, GCDB Data, 24K DRG, curehwys, Warranty Deed - Book 508, Page 416, Warranty Deed - Book 678, Page 328, Warranty Deed - Book 513, Page 993, Warranty Deed - Book 515, Page 381, Warranty Deed - Book 245, Page 320

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park/Curecanti National Recreation Area

procstep.procdesc: Copied D. Roberts' new parcel line to old boundary coverage with Arc "SEL" and "PUT" commands. Old boundary line in that area was then deleted. Coverage was then built in ArcEdit with "BUILD" command to obtain topology and labels. Acres were then recalculated.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park/Curecanti National Recreation Area

overview.eaover: The first six attribute items in the table are typical Arc feature class format. See www.esri.com for more information. None of these items are user defined. The user defined items in the curebdry.pat are: 1) Name - NPS, BLM and 2) Acres - software computed.

distinfo.distliab:
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics (if available) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such.
The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. Any related graphics (if available) are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not approriate to use the related graphics as data.
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service servers and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. Mention of trade names or commercial products in this metadata report does not constitute endorsement or recommendation for use by the U. S. Department of the Interior, U. S. Geological Survey and National Park Service.
